metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2525 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
epan/dissectors/packet-http2.c in the HTTP/2 dissector in Wireshark 2.0.xbefore 2.0.2 does not limit the amount of header data, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption or applicationcrash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2525` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1').
